snippet: The Metropolitan Museum of Art said new research backed up Cambodian claims that two 10th-century statues were improperly removed from the Koh Ker temple complex.
abstract: Metropolitan Museum of Art says it will repatriate two life-size sandstone masterworks to Cambodia; statues known as the Kneeling Attendants, have guarded the doorway to the Met’s Southeast Asian galleries since they opened in 1994; no timetable has been set for return.

byline.original: By TOM MASHBERG and RALPH BLUMENTHAL

lead_paragraph: The Metropolitan Museum of Art said new research backed up Cambodian claims that two 10th-century statues were improperly removed from the Koh Ker temple complex.

headline.seo: The Met Plans to Return Statues to Cambodia
headline.main: The Met Will Return a Pair of Statues to Cambodia
headline.print_headline: The Met Plans To Return Art To Cambodia
